Package au.edu.anu.qgraph.queries.graph.element

Class ElementProperty

java.lang.Object
au.edu.anu.qgraph.queries.QueryAdaptor
au.edu.anu.qgraph.queries.graph.element.ElementProperty
All Implemented Interfaces:
Queryable
public class ElementProperty extends QueryAdaptor

A Queryable to check that an object has a property and (optionally) a value.

Type of input to process()
ReadOnlyPropertyList or ReadOnlyDataHolder (remember that SimplePropertyList and DataHolder are descendants of these, and as such also constitute valid input)
Type of result
the property value, if getValue() has been called. In this case, the returned value is equal to the argument passed to defaultValue(...) if the property did not exist in input. Otherwise no result
Fails if
  1. input does not have a property named as the argument passed to key(...) and optional() has not been called (i.e., the property is required but not found)
  2. input property named as the argument passed to key(...) does not satisfy the query argument passed to query(...)
  3. input property named as the argument passed to key(...) value does not match the valued passed as argument to value(...)
Author:
Shayne Flint - 26/3/2012
refactored by Jacques Gignoux - 15/4/2019
an Iand Davies - Feb. 2021
See Also:
CoreQueries.hasProperty(String), CoreQueries.hasProperty(String, Object), CoreQueries.hasProperty(String, Queryable), CoreQueries.hasOptionalProperty(String, Queryable), CoreQueries.getProperty(String, Object), CoreQueries.getProperty(String)
